name: Regione Toscana - Ufficio di collegamento con le Istituzioni Comunitarie a Bruxelles
goal:
As governmental regional body, Regione Toscana pursues Institutional interests.

Main goals are:
Good governance of Tuscany;
Good management of European Structural and Innovation Funds;
Implementantion at regional level of European Regulations;
Supporting Regional actors in participating to EU initiatives;
Participation to European projects;
Participation to the activities of the Committee of the Regions.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Banking and financial services, Borders and Security, Budget, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Consumers, Culture, Culture and media, Customs, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Environment, European Neighbourhood Policy, External Relations, Food Safety, Foreign affairs and security policy, Fraud prevention, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Institutional affairs, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Migration and asylum, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Sport, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives:
As Regional Gevernment, Tuscany Region is following all existing policies which fall under its institutional competences.

A specific interest is devoted to:
Smart Specialization Platforms;
European funding programmes (eg. H2020, LIFE+, etc.);
European Structural and Investment Funds;
EFSI (Juncker Plan);
State Aids regulations.
